c74object.name: cage.sdif.ptrack.toroll
c74object.digest: Import a partial tracking SDIF analysis into a bach.roll
c74object.description: Imports and displays a partial tracking SDIF analysis into a bach.roll object. Each stream is mapped to a different voice. Each partial is output as a note.

inlet.description: The SDIF analysis containing partial tracking information, as the one output by bach.readsdif.
Partial amplitude output from this lambda outlet can be mapped into velocities to be re-injected into this lambda inlet.

outlet.description: Partial amplitudes are output from this lambda outlet. Such amplitudes might be mapped into velocities to be re-injected into the lambda inlet.

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the information imported from the most recently input analysis llll.

method.name: llll
method.description:
An llll in first inlet is expected to contain the llll form of a partial tracking SDIF analysis (as the one output by bach.readsdif). The output bach.roll's gathered syntax is sent through the outlet (each SDIF stream corresponding to a voice).
An llll in second inlet is converted into an int.

attribute.name: align
allowglissandi
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to convert partials into note with a glissando duration line. The granularity of the glissando is also determined by the first element of the reducethresh attribute. By default this attribute is off.

attribute.name: ampslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of the slot which will contain the amplitude envelope of each partial, or leave 0 to ignore this envelope (default).

attribute.name: freqrange
attribute.description: Sets a custom frequency range for outputting partials: a minimum frequency and a maximum frequency, both in Hertz. Only partials having at least one peak within such range are output. Default frequency range is 20 Hz to 20000 Hz.

attribute.name: minamp
attribute.description: Sets a minimum amplitude threshold for a partial to be output. Only partials having at least one peak with a higher or equal amplitude are output. Default is 0.001.

attribute.name: mindur
attribute.description: Sets a minimum duration threshold for a partial to be output (in milliseconds). Only partials lasting at least the introduced number of milliseconds are output. Default is 10ms.

attribute.name: phaseslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of the slot which will contain the phase envelope of each partial, or leave 0 to ignore this envelope (default).

attribute.name: reducethresh
attribute.description: Envelopes and duration lines by default are not output with one breakpoint for each peak; on the contrary, such envelopes are smoothed (as bach.reducefunction does, with relative attribute set to 0). The smoothing thresholds (see the the thresh attribute of bach.reducefunction) are entered via this attribute, in the following sequence: the smoothing threshold for the duration line breakpoints (in midicents, default: 10), the smoothing threshold for the amplitude envelopes (default: 0.01), the smoothing threshold for the phase envelopes (default: 0.).

entry.name: Inlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: SDIF analysis as llll. The SDIF analysis containing partial tracking information, as the one output by bach.readsdif.

entry.name: Inlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: Lambda inlet. Partial amplitude output from this lambda outlet can be mapped into velocities to be re-injected into this lambda inlet.

entry.name: Outlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: Lambda outlet. Partial amplitudes are output from this lambda outlet. Such amplitudes might be mapped into velocities to be re-injected into the lambda inlet.
